gameFiles

Class CollisionResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameFiles.CollisionResponse

  • public class CollisionResponse
extends java.lang.Object
    This object captures the collision responses, if collision is detected. The collision time is initialized (or reset) to infinity (Float.MAX_VALUE). The collision detection methods detect collision within a given time limit. If collision is detected within the time limit, they shall update the collision time, as well as compute and update newSpeedX and newSpeedY. This instance will not reflect collision detected beyond time limit, which is assumed to be meaningless. We use the collision time to compute newX and newY. Hence, there is no need to store the newX and newY. To prevent crossing the bounds, getNewX() and getNewY() subtract the collision time by a small threshold, instead of returning the impact point.
    Version:
    v0.3 (30 October 2010)
    Author:
    Hock-Chuan Chuan
